Class StrUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jruyi.common.StrUtil

  • public final class StrUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A string utility class.

      • filterProps

        public static java.lang.String filterProps(java.lang.String target)
        Returns a copy of the given string target, with the system properties substituted using syntax ${<property name>}. The property substitution can be nested.

        This string itself will be returned, if it has no properties to be substituted.

        Parameters:
        target - the string to be filtered
        Returns:
        a copy of the given string that is filtered, or this string if it has no properties to be substituted

      • fitlerProps

        public static java.lang.String fitlerProps(java.lang.String target,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        Returns a copy of the given string target, with the given properties and system properties substituted using syntax ${<property name>}. The property substitution can be nested. The given properties have higher precedence than system properties.

        This string itself will be returned, if it has no properties to be substituted.

        Parameters:
        target - the string to be filtered
        properties - the properties besides system properties to be substituted
        Returns:
        a copy of the given string that is filtered, or this string if it has no properties to be substituted

      • filterProps

        public static java.lang.String filterProps(java.lang.String target,
                           org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
        Returns a copy of the given string target, with the OSGi framework properties and system properties substituted using syntax ${<property name>}. The property substitution can be nested. The OSGi framework properties have higher precedence than system properties.

        This string itself will be returned, if it has no properties to be substituted.

        Parameters:
        target - the string to be filtered
        context - the bundle context to get the OSGi framework properties
        Returns:
        a copy of the given string that is filtered, or this string if it has no properties to be substituted

      • filterProps

        public static java.lang.String filterProps(java.lang.String target,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties,
                           org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
        Returns a copy of the given string target, with the given properties, OSGi framework properties and system properties substituted using syntax ${<property name>}. The property substitution can be nested. The precedence of properties to be taken for substitution from highest to lowest is the given properties, OSGi framework properties and system properties.

        This string itself will be returned, if it has no properties to be substituted.

        Parameters:
        target - the string to be filtered
        properties - the properties besides OSGi framework properties and system properties to be substituted
        context - the bundle context to get the OSGi framework properties
        Returns:
        a copy of the given string that is filtered, or this string if it has no properties to be substituted

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.Object obj0,
                    java.lang.Object obj1)
        Concatenates the provided arguments into a single String. Null argument is treated as an empty string.
        Parameters:
        obj0 - the first Object to construct the string
        obj1 - the second Object to construct the string
        Returns:
        the String constructed
        Since:
        1.1

        obj2 - the third Object to construct the string.
        obj3 - the fourth Object to construct the string.

        the String constructed.

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.Object obj,
                    java.lang.Object... objs)
        Concatenates the string values of the given objs by using the StringBuilder object associated with the current thread, and returns the constructed String. Null argument is treated as an empty string.

        obj - the first Object to construct the string.
        objs - the rest Objects to construct the string.
        Returns:
        the String constructed.

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(char[] array,
                    char delimiter)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.

        No delimiter is added before or after the list.

        Parameters:
        array - the array of values to join together, may be null
        delimiter - the delimiter character to use
        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null array input
        Since:
        1.1

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(char[] array,
                    int begin,
                    int end,
                    char delimiter)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.

        No delimiter is added before or after the list.

        Parameters:
        array - the array of values to join together, may be null
        begin - start joining at this offset
        end - stop joining at this offset
        delimiter - the delimiter character to use
        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null array input
        Since:
        1.1

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(long[] array,
                    int begin,
                    int end,
                    char delimiter)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.

        No delimiter is added before or after the list.

        Parameters:
        array - the array of values to join together, may be null
        begin - start joining at this offset
        end - stop joining at this offset
        delimiter - the delimiter character to use
        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null array input
        Since:
        1.1

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(long[] array,
                    java.lang.String delimiter)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.

        No delimiter is added before or after the list.

        Parameters:
        array - the array of values to join together, may be null
        delimiter - the delimiter string to use, null treated as empty string
        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null array input
        Since:
        1.1

        public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.Object[] array,
                    int begin,
                    int end,
                    java.lang.String delimiter)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.

        No delimiter is added before or after the list. A null delimiter is the same as an empty string.

        Parameters:
        array - the array of values to join together, may be null
        begin - start joining at this offset
        end - stop joining at this offset
        delimiter - the delimiter string to use, null treated as empty string
        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null array input
        Since:
        1.1

                    char delimiter)

        No delimiter is added before or after the list.

        Parameters:
        iterable - the Iterable providing the values to join together, may be null

        Returns:
        the joined String, null if null iterable input

      • deeplyBuild

        public static java.lang.String deeplyBuild(java.lang.Object obj)
        Returns a String constructed as follows. 
         StringBuilder.get().deeplyAppend(obj).toStringAndClose()
        Parameters:
        obj - of which the String value is returned.
        Returns:
        the String value of the given obj.

      • deeplyBuild

        public static java.lang.String deeplyBuild(java.lang.Object obj0,
                           java.lang.Object obj1)
        Returns a String constructed as follows. 
         StringBuilder.get().deeplyAppend(obj0).deeplyAppend(obj1).toStringAndClose()
        Parameters:
        obj0 - the first Object to construct the string.
        obj1 - the second Object to construct the string.
        Returns:
        the String constructed.

      • deeplyBuild

        public static java.lang.String deeplyBuild(java.lang.Object... objs)
        Returns a String constructed as follows. 
         StringBuilder.get().deeplyAppend(objs[0])...deeplyAppend(objs[objs.length -1]).toString()
        Parameters:
        objs - the rest arguments forming the string to be built.
        Returns:
        the String object constructed.
